intro: Hippeastrum cybister, commonly known as the Cybister amaryllis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in winter or early spring. The plant produces strap-shaped leaves that are broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms. The bulbs of Hippeastrum cybister are also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
